title: What to Put in Your Spring Forage Mix

tasks.task: Participate in a virtual discussion about spring cover crop forage options.
subtasks: Access the smart mix calculator at smartmix.greencoverseed.com.
Create a custom cover crop mix named "Grandpa's East 40 for 40 acres."
Input the hometown zip code to calculate average rainfall and frost dates.
Choose the bagging option for drilling cover forage mix.
Select the cash crop as wheat (no time for a spring cash crop).
Set the mix goal to supplemental grazing.
Choose legumes (spring forage peas and crimson clover) for nitrogen fixation and biomass.
Select grasses (spring oats, annual rye grass) for tonnage and forage quality.
Add brassicas (kale and collards) for palatable leaves and soil health.
Include mycorrhizal species (clover and oats) to enhance nutrient uptake.
Adjust the mix components to achieve approximately 1.5 million seeds per acre.
Customize seeding rates based on local conditions and soil type.
Explore alternative cereal options like spring barley or triticale.
Consider hay inventory needs in drought-affected areas for potential forage production.
Provide helpful feedback on seeding rates and species selection.
